titleStmt.title: Lewis N. Dembitz et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1774

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: To his Exelency Thos E Bramlette Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The undersigned your Petitioners residents of the first District of the city of Louisville would most respectfully ask that G. F. Barth as citizen and resident of said district be appointed and commissioned as Justice of the Peace in and for said district their being a vacancy occasioned by the death of Capt Conrad Shroeder we know said Barth to be an honest Gentleman and well qualified to fill said office we having been acquainted with him for many years

Respectfully
not of the District
Lewis N Dembitz
Henry Pirtle
R. H. Rousseau
Thos W. Gibson
Hamilton Pope
Nat Wolfe
W. A. Hauser
H. Bindewald
Fred. T. Polkman
1st District
B. Auer
Fr. Hosch
G. Ch. Stern
John Lutzelschwab
Frederick Weihe
Joseph Wahl
Martin Bijur
J B Gregory
J. G. Kant
E. Dietzman
J. A. Isert
Jacob Ruckstahl
Wm Vogt
George Hoerster
Henry Knofer
F Beck
John B Ewing
John Selsifer
Henry Miller
Stephen Schwent
A. Lucking
Perryy Scholnlamb
Fasol Wiedeman
Ch Rueff
Henry Schaler
Wm Modenbach
B Bockmen
H. Pelle
Saml Sulzer
Jacob Wollmer
Ford Fischer
Worny Wuib.
F. J. Haselwander
Aloir
A MacFelland

Jefferson Co
J P.
Dis No 2
Apptd
24th Feby/64
